,

Creating your grid site may seem daunting at first, but believe us.. itâ€™s not!

,

On this site, weâ€™re collating all the information that we have learnt from creating many, many grid sites.. below youâ€™ll find a simple video showing the very first stages of creating a site, but from there we can look at all other aspects.

,

Adding forms, videos, stores.. whatever you are looking for on your site, we can help get it set up..

,

..keep checking back for more articles and tips.. thanks!

,

*btw.. weâ€™ll show you how to add the facebook comments box on our social media section.. slight change to the code facebook gives you, and we can have it working perfectly.. even on your visitors mobile phone..

item.description:
setting up your 1st site..

,,

* ..in the video section on this site, you can see how we embedded this video full width on both the home page, and also on itâ€™s own page. It also means that the video will be available on the mobile version of your site with no issuesâ€¦

item.title: new content added
item.description:
new content added

,

We have sub sites now to demonstrate various elements that can be useful on your grid site. From the menu top left, you can see we have now added ideas for forms, a store, and how to best add videos to your grid site. For the full list you can jump here ðŸ‘ˆ

,

But with any site, the best idea is to build up your site with content, and on the grid one of the under used methods we believe is the idea of sharing urls. Itâ€™s one of the options when you add more content.

,
“Content is king.” ~ Bill Gates
,

Simply paste the link to a site or an article where it says and press enter. Done. Molly will then visit the site and create an article. Over time sheâ€™ll have created a whole site for you.

,,

A good example of this is on the resources page of d-zign.us. All created by simply gathering links to useful sites or articles.

,

item.title: typography..
item.description:
typography..

,

Normally we let Molly choose the font for our sites, and leave it at that.. you can redesign a few times if you donâ€™t like her choice, and sheâ€™ll come back with alternatives..

,

But what if you want a specific font say.. just for headings to articles ? ..trying to think of a reason, but what if youâ€™re a wedding business and want a more flamboyant heading..

,

Well we can do this.. we can do this through CSS and using an embedded html window.

,

For cross browser support, weâ€™ve tried various methods, but the only way we have found that is consistent is by using fonts from Google.

,

We would probably only use this for article headings, but here is an example, using an embedded window.. set the size to 100.. the same code can be used for any Google font.. note as we are using CSS on the grid site, the code needs to be within <style>â€¦ </style> tags..

,

Here is our code :

,
<style>

@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Italianno');

.fancy4 {
font-family: 'Italianno', cursive;
font-size: 80px;
}
</style>

<div class="fancy4">The Wedding of Jon & Daenerys</div>
,

and the result.. would make a great wedding header to an article.. just never gonna happen when he finds out she is his Auntâ€¦ ðŸ˜³

,
